Docs.summary:
Creates a using:
'NameClaimType': If NameClaimTypeRetriever is set, call delegate, else call NameClaimType. If the result is a null or empty string, use .
'RoleClaimType': If RoleClaimTypeRetriever is set, call delegate, else call RoleClaimType. If the result is a null or empty string, use .
Docs.returns: A with Authentication, NameClaimType and RoleClaimType set.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the original token should be saved after the security token is validated.
Docs.remarks: The runtime will consult this value and save the original token that was validated.

Docs.summary: Gets or set the that store tokens that can be checked to help detect token replay.
Docs.remarks: If set, then tokens must have an expiration time or the runtime will fault.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to validate the token replay of the token
Docs.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to validate the token replay of the token, instead of normal processing. If is false, this delegate will not be called.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateActor : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if an actor token is detected, whether it should be validated.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateAudience : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the audience will be validated during token validation.
Docs.remarks: Validation of the audience, mitigates forwarding attacks. For example, a site that receives a token, could not replay it to another side. A forwarded token would contain the audience of the original site.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateIssuer : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the issuer will be validated during token validation.
Docs.remarks: Validation of the issuer mitigates forwarding attacks that can occur when an IdentityProvider represents multiple tenants and signs tokens with the same keys. It is possible that a token issued for the same audience could be from a different tenant. For example an application could accept users from contoso.onmicrosoft.com but not fabrikam.onmicrosoft.com, both valid tenants. A application that accepts tokens from fabrikam could forward them to the application that accepts tokens for contoso.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateIssuerSigningKey : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that controls if validation of the that signed the securityToken is called.
Docs.remarks: It is possible for tokens to contain the public key needed to check the signature. For example, X509Data can be hydrated into an X509Certificate, which can be used to validate the signature. In these cases it is important to validate the SigningKey that was used to validate the signature.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateLifetime : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the lifetime will be validated during token validation.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateTokenReplay : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the token replay will be validated during token validation.
